moves.2... exd4 3. Nf3: In the moment I play this variation
moves.4... dxc3 5. Nxc3: Gambit - White's one pawn late but has 3 pieces out against one for black
moves.5... Bb4: Seems to be the best move in this opening.
moves.6. Bc4: The most agressive response.  If 7. ... Bxc3 8. bxc3 white has an isolated pawn but 4 pieces out against one for black and very strong attack possibilities for white on the center.
moves.8... O-O 9. Qc2: Protecting e and letting a place for the f rook on the semi open file.
moves.9... d6: enabling the LSB to leave his garage.
moves.10. e5: White's plan is to launsh a massive attack on the center.
moves.13... Bd7: But black has material advantage and if he manages to defend, white will be on trouble
moves.14. f4: White throws all his forces on the center. Black is in serious trouble for white has many possibilities of attack but 14. Qb3 could have been better.
moves.14... c6: White didn't see the point of this move.
moves.15. Qb3:
?? Blunder - The losing move. White carries on attacking : fork attack 16. Bxf7+ or 16. Qxb7.
 16. Bd6 would have been batter. for if 16. ... b6 17. Nd6 or 16. Kh1.
moves.16... axb6: The DSB is under menace, now black has the initiative, is 2 pawns ahead. White is doomed.
moves.17... Rxe5 18. Bxf7+ Kxf7 19. Rxd7+ Kg6: Black plays carefully, avoiding 19. ... Ke8 19. ... Kg8 19. ... Ke6 which would have permitted white to equilibrate the game.
moves.20. Rxb7: From now on it's finished. White tries to obtain a draw.
